result.execSummary:
The defendant William Troy Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Case #22 CF 07 & any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Def shall sign any and all releases of information with New Day treatment facility so that the DOC can monitor his compliance and attendance at treatment programs.
Def shall return to WI and report to the DOC w/in 48 hrs of discharge for any reason from New Day treatment facility in the State of MI.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Defendant is not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting, meeting, or in a correctional setting. 
The defendant is ordered to random testing.
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland w/in 48 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes:
The def shall sign any and all releases of information with New Day treatment facility so that the DOC can monitor his compliance and attendance at treatment programs.
The def shall return to WI and report to the DOC w/in 48 hrs of discharge for any reason from New Day treatment facility in the State of MI.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Defendant is not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting, meeting, or in a correctional setting. 
The defendant is ordered to random testing. 
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

timeConds.notes:
Def granted huber release privledges.
This conditional jail shall be stayed pending the def's successful completion and discharge of inpatient treatment at the New Day facility in the State of MI, including any recommended extension and return to WI.  This jail time would commence after any other period of confinement or sentence.  IF def completes proram successfully, he will not have to serve this jail time.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Ct 1 -BUT- Consecutive to any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Troy Ford

records.addlTxt: 2:30 PM - 22 CF 07, 22 CF 110 - Defendant William Troy Ford appeared by video (fr ACJ).  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for William Troy Ford.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Judge McK is assgn'd to 22 CF 110 & bth parties req Judge S hear case & def agrees.  PLEAS - see Pge 2
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Oct 3;  ka

10:07 AM Defendant William Troy Ford appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for William Troy Ford.  Reviewed compliant, waive reading, waive prelim hearing, discussed with attorney, understands information, understands rights giving up.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving prelim hearing, court accepts waiver.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed in Ashland County case is bound over for arraignment.  State filed information contains same charges as criminal compliant.  Waives reading, pleas NG, noted.  Attorney filing motion for bail reduction.  
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
